FoxDot.Patterns package¶

Submodules¶

FoxDot.Patterns.Base module¶

class FoxDot.Patterns.Base.PGroup(data)¶

Bases: FoxDot.Patterns.Base.Pattern

Class to represent any groupings of notes as denoted by brackets

BRACKETS = '(%s)'¶
NEST_ME = False¶
copy()¶

Returns a new PGroup with self.data

make()¶

Overrides the Pattern.make() method to allow PGroup to invert nesting:

i.e. (0,[1,2]) -> [(0,1),(0,2)] and NEST_ME flag is set to False i.e. (0,[1,2],[3,4]) -> [(0,1,3),(0,2,4)]

class FoxDot.Patterns.Base.Pattern(data)¶

Bases: list

Abstract pattern class.

BRACKETS = '[%s]'¶
NEST_ME = True¶
all(func=<function <lambda> at 0x0000000003EA4CF8>)¶

Returns true if all of the patterns contents satisfies func(x) - default is nonzero

append(item)¶
contains_nest()¶

Returns true if the

copy()¶
fromString(string)¶

Used to convert a string of characters into a pattern.

Rather unintuitively: Characters in square brackets, [], are placed in a tuple - and then become PGroups - and characters in round brackets, (), are added into a nested list

“x-o(-[oo])” -> [“x”,”-”,”o”,”-”,”x”,”-”,”o”,(“o”,”o”)]

items()¶
list()¶
make()¶

This method automatically laces and groups the data

pipe(pattern)¶

Concatonates this patterns stream with another

stretch(size)¶

Stretches (repeats) the contents until len(Pattern) == size

string()¶

Returns a string made up of all the values:

PSeq([1,”x”,(1,1),(“x”,”x”)]).string() -> “1x11xx”

FoxDot.Patterns.Base.Pgroup¶

Alias for PGroup

alias of PGroup

FoxDot.Patterns.Base.Place(data)¶

nested patterns are stretched e.g. [[1,0],0,1,0] would be returned as [1,0,1,0,0,0,1,0]

FoxDot.Patterns.Base.asStream(data)¶

Forces any data into a pattern form

FoxDot.Patterns.Base.contains_nest(data)¶

Returns true if any items in data are ‘nest-able’ patterns

FoxDot.Patterns.Base.nested(data)¶

Returns true is data is any kind of pattern (inc. lists) EXCEPT PGroups or TimeVars

FoxDot.Patterns.Feeders module¶

Function in this module take a single Player object as its arguments, changes their state, and return None

These are to be used in a Player Object’s every(n, function) method and create a function that is called every n beats

Returns the largest length pattern

FoxDot.Patterns.Operations.modi(array, i)¶

Returns the modular index i.e. modi([0,1,2],4) will return 1
